sen.j: 建勲神社（たけいさおじんじゃ）は、京都市北区 (京都市)の船岡山の中腹にある神社である。
sen.e: Takeisao-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located on the side of Mt. Funaoka in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
Takeisao-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located on the side of Mt. Funaoka in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
Takeisao-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located halfway up of Mt. Funaoka in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 織田信長を主祭神とし、子の織田信忠を配祀する。
sen.e: The main deity is Nobunaga ODA who is enshrined alongside his son Nobutada ODA.
The main deity is Nobunaga ODA who is enshrined alongside his son Nobutada ODA.
The main deity is Nobunaga ODA who is enshrined alongside his son Nobutada ODA.

sen.j: 旧近代社格制度は別格官幣社。
sen.e: It was ranked as a Bekkaku Kanpeisha under the old shrine classification system.
It was ranked as a Bekkaku Kanpeisha under the old shrine classification system.
It was ranked as a Bekkaku Kanpeisha (a special government shrine) under the old shrine classification system.

sen.j: 正しくは「たけいさおじんじゃ」と読むが、一般には「けんくんじんじゃ」と呼ばれ、「建勲（けんくん）さん」と通称される。
sen.e: The correct reading of the shrine name is "Takeisao-jinja" but it is generally read "Kenkun-jinja", and the shrine is commonly known as "Kenkun-san".
The correct reading of the shrine name is "Takeisao-jinja" but it is generally read "Kenkun-jinja", and the shrine is commonly known as "Kenkun-san".
The correct reading of the shrine name is 'Takeisao-jinja' but it is generally read 'Kenkun-jinja,' and the shrine is commonly known as 'Kenkun-san.'

sen.j: 旧称建織田社（たけおだしゃ）、建勲社。
sen.e: The shrine has formerly been named Takeoda-sha Shrine and Kenkun-sha Shrine.
The shrine has formerly been named Takeoda-sha Shrine and Kenkun-sha Shrine.
The shrine has formerly been named Takeoda-sha Shrine and Kenkun-sha Shrine.
History
History
History

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）、戦国時代 (日本)を天下統一、朝儀復興などを進めた織田信長を賛えるための建織田社の創建が決定した。
sen.e: In 1869, the decision was made to build a shrine honoring Nobunaga ODA who promoted the unification the country and the restoration the court council during the Warring States period.
In 1869, the decision was made to build a shrine honoring Nobunaga ODA who promoted the unification the country and the restoration the court council during the Warring States period.

In 1869, the decision was made to build a shrine honoring Nobunaga ODA who promoted the unification the country and the restoration the court council during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 翌明治3年（1870年）、東京の織田信長の子孫の邸内と織田家旧領地の山形県天童市に建勲社（現在は建勲神社 (天童市)に改称）が造営された。
sen.e: In the following year, Kenkun-sha Shrines (presently renamed Kenkun-jinja Shrine (Tendo City)) were constructed at the Tokyo estate of Nobunaga ODA's descendants and in the Oda family's former territory of Tendo City in Yamagata Prefecture.

In the following year, Kenkun-sha Shrines (presently renamed Kenkun-jinja Shrine (Tendo City)) were constructed at the Tokyo estate of Nobunaga ODA's descendants and in the Oda family's former territory of Tendo City in Yamagata Prefecture.

In the following year, Kenkun-sha Shrines (presently renamed Kenkun-jinja Shrine (Tendo City)) were constructed at the Tokyo estate of Nobunaga ODA's descendants and in the Oda family's former territory of Tendo City in Yamagata Prefecture.

sen.j: 明治8年（1875年）に別格官幣社に列格した。
sen.e: These shrine was classified as a Bekkaku Kanpeisha in 1875.
These shrine was classified as a Bekkaku Kanpeisha in 1875.
These shrines were classified as a Bekkaku Kanpeisha in 1875.

sen.j: 現在地の船岡山は平安京の四神相応の玄武に位置し、豊臣秀吉によって信長の廟所と定められた地である。
sen.e: The current location on Mt. Funaoka is the site of the Genbu god of Heian-kyo and was chosen by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI to be the place of Nobunaga ODA's mausoleum.
The current location on Mt. Funaoka is the site of the Genbu god of Heian-kyo and was chosen by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI to be the place of Nobunaga ODA's mausoleum.
The current location on Mt. Funaoka is the site of the Genbu god of Heian-kyo and was chosen by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI to be the place of Nobunaga ODA's mausoleum.

sen.j: その船岡山に神社を移すことになり、明治13年（1880年）、社殿が竣工して東京より遷座した。
sen.e: It was decided that Takeisao-jinja Shrine would be relocated from Tokyo to Mt. Funaoka and the move was completed in 1880.
It was decided that Takeisao-jinja Shrine would be relocated from Tokyo to Mt. Funaoka and the move was completed in 1880.
It was decided that Takeisao-jinja Shrine would be relocated from Tokyo to Mt. Funaoka and the move was completed in 1880 when the main building construction was finished.
sen.cmt: when the main building construction was finished

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）の信長上洛の日に因み、10月19日に船岡大祭が行われる。
sen.e: The Funaoka Taisai festival is held on October 19th in commemoration of Nobunaga ODA's arrival in Kyoto.
The Funaoka Taisai festival is held on October 19th in commemoration of Nobunaga ODA's arrival in Kyoto.
The Funaoka Taisai festival is held on October 19 in commemoration of Nobunaga ODA's arrival in Kyoto in 1568.

sen.e: Take the Kyoto City Bus to "Kenkun-jinja mae" bus stop and walk.
